title: Finkelstein & Krinsk Brings National Class Action Against Volkswagen For Emissions Fraud In 2009-2015 "Clean Diesel" Vehicles
text:
Finkelstein & Krinsk LLP
SAN DIEGO , Sept. 24, On September 23, 2015 , the nationally recognized law firm of Finkelstein & Krinsk LLP filed a class action lawsuit against Volkswagen Group of America, Inc. ("Volkswagen") alleging that Volkswagen covertly and intentionally misrepresented to consumers that its "Clean Diesel" vehicles satisfied EPA air pollution standards when, in fact, the vehicles did not and were rigged to show that they did.
According to the EPA, Volkswagen knew its vehicles failed to meet EPA pollution standards and actively concealed this information from consumers and regulators. Volkswagen installed sophisticated software that activated pollution controls only when vehicles were being tested for emissions compliance. However, during routine driving, the "Clean Diesel" vehicles emit up to 40 times more pollution than legally permitted, and the affected vehicles are unfit to be registered in the United States. The pertinent vehicles now include:
Volkswagen Jetta (Model Years 2009 – 2015) Volkswagen Beetle (Model Years 2009 – 2015) Volkswagen Golf (Model Years 2009 – 2015) Volkswagen Passat (Model Years 2014-2015) Audi A3 (Model Years 2009 – 2015) Finkelstein & Krinsk has been successfully bringing consumer class actions for over 30 years, and represents corporate, union and individual clients throughout the United States. To ensure that you are eligible to recover in any successful action, you may seek to become a plaintiff in the case. Doing so can enhance the likelihood that other consumers from your state will also be able to participate in any recovery and damages. If you would like to participate in the class action lawsuit or discuss your rights at no cost to you , please contact William R. Restis, Esq. toll free at 877-493-5366, or simply provide your name and contact information via e-mail at fk@classactionlaw.com and the complaint will be forwarded to you.
